newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian crude - September market sees active buying.
newsitem.headline: Asian crude - September market sees active buying.

text.p: Asia's crude market saw active trading on Middle East grades, as Asian refiners started to cover September requirements, traders said on Thursday.
September Oman was heard traded twice, to a major at Dubai quotes +3 cents per barrel and to a Japanese at Dubai +5.
A western trader heard sold Oman to a South Korean refiner at Dubai +5, but this was in exchange for a cargo of Dubai crude with a price differential of 20 cents between the grades.
A September Qatar Marine was heard sold by a western trader to a U.S. major, but the price level was uncertain, heard by some traders as Dubai +5 and others as Dubai +10.
There was very little talk of where prices would be on an OSP, although Oman bids were expected to come from MPM -25/-35.
Traders said buyers assessed it economic to pay the low premiums over Dubai quotes for grades that are much higher in quality than Dubai crude.
A late August cargo of Murban was also sold by a western trader to Kenya.
The price level was a premium of 67 cents over the September ADNOC price, on a cost and freight (c+f) basis.
China heard bought a 950,000 barrel cargo of August Escalante crude from a trader at WTI -$2.80 c+f China.
This is the only the third cargo of Escalante crude that China has bought, following its very first purchase in June.
Trading on the light Asian crudes was quiet, with September sellers offering higher levels compared to August.
